clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Effect of CGF in Promoting Mechanical-stretch Induced in Vivo Skin Regeneration
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Effect of CGF in Promoting Mechanical-stretch Induced in Vivo Skin

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluating whether autologous Concentrate Growth Factors(CGF) is safe and/or effective to accelerating skin regeneration and soft tissue expansion.

primary_outcome.measure: To Measure the Change in Inflation Volume of the Silicone Expander From Baseline at 8 Weeks
primary_outcome.description: Record the inflation volume(ml) of each expander with the maintained inner pressure. The inflation volume was recorded according to the injection volume during expansion.

secondary_outcome.measure: To Measure the Texture of Expanded Flap With Canfield's Visia Scanner
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate skin texture with Canfield's Visia skin analysis imaging system and compare the characteristics including RBX red, RBX brown, pores, spots, et al.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to approximately 24 months after study start
secondary_outcome.description: Including expanded flap ischaemia, necrosis, fluidify, infection, and all other adverse events

arm_group.description: Concentrate Growth Factors(CGF) will be harvested through centrifugation afte intravenous blood collection. Venous blood was collected in tube and then centrifuged in Medifuge system（Thermo Scientific）. About 2ml liquid CGF can be harvested from 9ml venous blood. Patients will receive autologous CGF injection subdermally to expanded skin at the density of 0.02 ml/cm2.
0.9% saline will be injected into expanded skin for control study. Patients will receive saline injection subdermally to expanded skin at the density of 0.02 ml/cm2.

intervention.description: CGF injection subdermally to expanded skin at the density of 0.02ml/cm2.
Saline will be injected into expanded skin
